alert.note: Alert for Camden; Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 12:20AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Ocean, Camden, northeastern Gloucester and central Burlington Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1220 AM EDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Presidential Lakes to Turnersville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Lakewood, Evesham, Deptford, Voorhees, Medford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Beachwood, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Berlin, Tabernacle, Shamong, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Magnolia and Westville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 25 and 26, and between mile markers 28 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 72 and 94. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 36 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Southeastern Burlington
